member.name: M:Gentex.MES.LegacyDataClient.StreamedResponseClient.ExportBy_Datasource_PartNumber_IdentifierCode(Gentex.MES.LegacyDataClient.ExportBy_Datasource_PartNumber_IdentifierCode_Request)
member.summary: ExportBy_Datasource_PartNumber_IdentifierCode
member.remarks: The operation requires that you specify at least 1 item for either Datasource, PartNumber, IdentifierCode. If specifying more than 1 it will be treated as an AND condition. You have the option to specify a Start and\or End Date, if Start Date is not supplied the time span will default to -24hrs from the time of the request or from the End Date if it was specified. You also have the option to specify how many records you want, if not supplied the default is 1000. You can optionally specify Metadata key names and\or Measurement names independently. The fluent interface provides the following options for specifying Metadata Key name(s): 1. IncludeAllMetaDataKeyNames 2. IncludeMetaDataKeyNames – You have the option to specify one or more names The fluent interface provides the following options for specifying Measurement name(s): 1. IncludeAllMeasurements IncludeMeasurementNames – You have the option to specify one or more names You can optionally specify if you only want tests that failed. The default is to include all tests that meet the specification. You can optionally specify if you only want measurements that passed or failed. The default is to include both if not specified. Also note that the export will only return Metadata key name items unless you’ve included measurement(s). Three functions have been provided on the response object that can normalize (each record will have the same key names and number of keys) the results. The default sort order of the keys is Ascending. A Descending order function and a custom sort order function have also been provided.
